ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: FRAIL Fatigue Scale: How much of the time during the past 4 weeks did you feel tired?
Notes: 1=All of the time; 2=Most of the time; 3=Sometimes; 4=A little of the time; 5=None of the time
0=No (Sometimes, A little of the time, or none of the time);1= Yes (All of the time or most of the time)

ElementDescription: FRAIL Resistance Score: By yourself and not using aids, do you have any difficulty walking up 10 steps alone without resting?
FRAIL Ambulation Score: By yourself and not using aids, do you have any difficulty walking several hundred yards?

Notes: 0 = No current diabetes or random BS < 220;1 = Diagnosis of diabetes or random BS >220

ElementDescription: Not including asthma, has a doctor told you that you have chronic lung disease such as chronic bronchitis or emphysema?
Has she/he ever been to a doctor for any of these thingsâ€¦Kidney Disease /Enfermedad Renal
Notes: 1 = Yes; 0 = No // Now I'd like to ask you about your child's use of health services during the past year and throughout his/her whole life.
0=No (up to 4 illnesses endorsed); 1=Yes (5 or more illnesses endorsed)
0 = Less than 5% weight loss in a year);1 = (Greater than or equal to 5% weight loss in a year)
0 = best condition/robust; 1 - 2 = pre-frail; 3 - 5 = frail; 5 = worst condition
